thread.title: Jeff Stelling claims he is NOT retiring from Gillette Soccer Saturday despite recent rumours
thread.title_full: Jeff Stelling claims he is NOT retiring from Gillette Soccer Saturday despite recent rumours

author: Jack Rathborn
title: Jeff Stelling claims he is NOT retiring from Gillette Soccer Saturday despite recent rumours
text:
Sport Jeff Stelling claims he is NOT retiring from Gillette Soccer Saturday despite recent rumours The Sky Sports presenter was reportedly ready to call time on his career but has since denied that is the case Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily     
Gillette Soccer Saturday anchor Jeff Stelling has revealed he is NOT ready to retire. 
The Sky Sports icon, who has helped make the cult show on Saturday afternoons, was rumoured to be ready to call time on his 40 years in the industry. 
But he has told reporters that he has "no intention" of retiring. 
Stelling, 62, is said to be targeted at least another 10 years in the industry before he calls it a day. 
As well as being the front of the hit live score show, Stelling as presented live Premier League coverage. Jeff Stelling is considering retirement after 40 years (Photo: Bryn Lennon/Getty Images) 
But he was reportedly ready to quit in order to spend more time in Portugal. 
“I don’t know how much longer I’ll do presenting. I’ve done it for 40 years," Stelling told the Daily Star. 
“I am not sure how long it will go on for. I might want to put my feet up. I am getting on – the next decision will be retirement.” 
“I want to stick my feet up on the beach. We spend as much time as we can in Portugal when it isn’t the football season. I love it there. I’d be very happy to spend a bit more time out there.” Like us on Facebook
